section.title: tar — The GNU version of the tar archiving utility
tar examples
section.screen:
tar -cvf foo.tar foo/ tar contents of folder foo in foo.tar
tar -xvf foo.tar extract foo.tar

section.title: gunzip
section.screen: tar -zcvf foo.tar foo/ tar contents of folder foo in foo.tar.gz
tar -xvzf foo.tar.gz extract gzipped foo.tar.gz

section.title: b2zip
section.screen:
tar -jcvf foo.tar.bz2 foo/ tar contents of folder foo in foo.tar.bz2
tar -jxvf foo.tar.bz2 extract b2zip foo.tar.bz2

section.title: compress
section.screen:
tar -Zcvf foo.tar.Z foo/ tar contents of folder foo in foo.tar.Z
tar -Zxvf foo.tar.Z extract compress foo.tar.Z

section.title: -t, --list
section.para: -t, --list list the contents of an archive
section.screen: tar tvf neo.tar.gz

# mkdir -p /www/test.com/www.test.com/ # echo helloworld > /www/test.com/www.test.com/test.txt # tar zcvf www.test.com.tar.gz /www/test.com/www.test.com/
# tar ztvf www.test.com.tar.gz drwxr-xr-x root/root 0 2013-08-08 15:24 www/test.com/www.test.com/ -rw-r--r-- root/root 11 2013-08-08 15:24 www/test.com/www.test.com/test.txt
# tar zxvf www.test.com.tar.gz www/test.com/www.test.com/ www/test.com/www.test.com/test.txt
# find www www www/test.com www/test.com/www.test.com www/test.com/www.test.com/test.txt

section.title: tar: Removing leading `/’ from member names
section.para: -P, --absolute-names don't strip leading `/'s from file names
section.screen:
$ tar -czvPf neo.tar.gz /home/neo/
$ tar -xzvPf neo.tar.gz

section.title: -C, --directory=DIR
section.screen: tar -xzvf neo.tar.gz -C /tmp

# tar zxvf www.test.com.tar.gz -C /tmp www/test.com/www.test.com/ www/test.com/www.test.com/test.txt
# find /tmp/www/ /tmp/www/ /tmp/www/test.com /tmp/www/test.com/www.test.com /tmp/www/test.com/www.test.com/test.txt
# rm -rf /www/test.com/*
# tar zxvf www.test.com.tar.gz -C / www/test.com/www.test.com/ www/test.com/www.test.com/test.txt
# find /www/test.com/ /www/test.com/ /www/test.com/www.test.com /www/test.com/www.test.com/test.txt

section.title: -P, --absolute-names don't strip leading `/'s from file names
section.screen: tar zcvfP www.test.com.tar.gz /www/test.com/www.test.com/ tar zxvfP www.test.com.tar.gz

section.title: --exclude
section.screen:
tar --exclude /home/neo -zcvf myfile.tar.gz /home/* /etc
tar zcvf rpmbuild/SOURCES/netkiller-1.0.tar.gz ~/workspace/public_html/* --exclude .git --exclude .svn

section.title: -T
section.screen:
find . -name "*.jpg" -print >list tar -T list -czvf picture.tar.gz
find /etc/ | tar czvf xxx1.tar.gz -T -

section.title: 日期过滤
section.para: 打包 2010/08/01 之后的文件和目录
section.screen: tar -N '2010/08/01' -zcvf home.tar.gz /home

section.title: 保留权限
section.screen: tar -zxvpf /tmp/etc.tar.gz /etc

section.title: -r, --append
section.para: 追加最近7天更改过的文件
section.screen: find / -type f -mtime -7 | xargs tar -rf weekly_incremental.tar

section.title: 远程传输
section.screen: tar -jcpvf - file.php | ssh root@172.16.3.1 "tar -jxpvf -"

section.title: 分卷压缩
section.screen:
分卷压缩一个目录：如doc
在doc目录的上次目录
#tar cvf doc | split -b 2m (已2M大小分卷压缩) #cat x* > doc.tar (合成分卷压缩包)

#tar czvf doc.tar.gz doc/ #tar czvfp - doc.tar.gz | split -b 5m #cat x* > doc.tar.gz
查看压缩包里面的内容:
#tar -tf doc.tar #tar -tzvf doc.tar.gz

section.title: cpio - copy files to and from archives
section.screen:
find /opt -print | cpio -o > opt.cpio
find . -type f -name '*.sh' -print | cpio -o | gzip >sh.cpio.gz
cpio –i < opt.cpio
